page.title: 18THE R.A.F. OVER LYVEDEN
page.content: Low_flying military aircraft from R.A.F.Wittering and U.S.A.F.Alconbury are often heard and seen in this area.The most common planes are Harriers, Phantoms and A_10's, the 'Tank_buster' aircraft. These cause some disturbance but on the whole do not appear to affect wild_life or arable farming. In fact there are only six houses in the whole of this block of the East Midlands, so the chances of any civilian being injured are remote.It is necessary for military pilots to practice low_flying in the 1980's so that they can fly 'under the radar'. Rural areas with a low population density are frequently used for this purpose, because there are less people to be affected by the noise. However, there are many pupils at this school who do not agree!
